blocks.text: Fastiloose! is a lightweight skirmish engine that invites customisation. It’s fast to learn, quick to play, and easy to adapt. Bring a pen, paper, and a die. That’s all you need!

Fastiloose! is the base ruleset for a 2 player, grid-based skirmish game built for small teams of fighters. It’s designed to avoid the lumbering pace of traditional, army-scale wargames and instead lean towards compact, tactical battles where every character matters.

Games are quick to set up and fast to play. Think of a sharp, decisive skirmish during a lunch break rather than a half-day campaign. The rules are portable and piece-agnostic. You don’t need a full, physical army or boxed set to begin.

At its core, all you need are these rules, a few sheets of paper, character tokens and a single six-sided die (d6). On top of this framework, optional Expansions and Modifier Decks can be added. These introduce options like the Fate Deck, Extension Classes, Terrain or Game Modes that shift the flow of play, allowing you to scale the depth and variety of each game.
This is the barebones game, without any add ons. No Fate Deck, No Modifiers or Extensions.

items: Teams : 3 fighters per side (choose from Base Classes)
Decide round order(Leading and Following) via coin flip or d6 roll : 1-3 vs 4-6.
Each fighter may move up to MOV squares (orthogonal only; no diagonals)
Each fighter may check if any enemies targets fall within their RANGE (orthogonal only; no diagonals)
If the target is within RANGE, the attacker rolls D6 + HIT
If the attacker’s total is higher, the attack succeeds → deal DAMAGE to the target’s HEALTH
If the attacker’s total is lower, the attack fails → no effect

blocks.text: This is Fastiloose! in its purest form. A pocket-sized skirmish game built for immediacy and replay. Everything else is a fancy bolt-on, easily stripped back to these simple roots.
Use the rules however you like, just don’t call it Fastiloose! unless you’ve kept the core intact.
Fastiloose! is a 2 player game played on a square-based grid.

items: 8x8(chessboard) is the standard-reference,  but any drawn grid will work.
For quick, balanced games, a square battlefield is simplest, but you can experiment with custom-shaped maps for variant play.
Each player builds a team from the Base Classes (8 total)
The default team size is 3 fighters, which on an 8×8 grid produces a fast, ~30-minute skirmish
Teams can be expanded freely for larger battles
You can field duplicates of the same base classes

blocks.text: Every fighter has a card with its stats.

items: MOV : Maximum movement distance per Movement Phase
HIT : Attack accuracy; added to a d6 roll during Combat Phase
DEF : Defense rating; added to a d6 roll when defending
DAMAGE : Amount of HEALTH lost by the target on a successful hit
RANGE : Maximum attack distance in one Combat Phase
SPLASH - Hits one square plus the four orthogonal adjacent squares (N, E, S, W)
MIXED - The fighter may choose between SINGLE or SPLASH per attack
Decide Leading Player and Following Player

blocks.text: The game starts with a d6 roll (1-3 vs 4-6), coin flip or similar 50/50 result deciding which player is the first and second to act.
The Movement Phase begins with the Leading Player first, then the Following Player.
Each fighter on a team may be moved up to n squares. With n being dictated by the fighters MOV stat on their Base Class card.
Once all fighters on the Leading Player’s team are moved, the Following player moves their own fighters.
MOV: 4 : This fighter may move up to 4 squares in total.
Diagonal Movement is NOT allowed using the Core Rules. Manhattan style(orthogonal) is used to measure MOV distance.
Each player will draw one card from the Fate Deck. All results of this card will be played out before proceeding with the next phase.
After all effects are resolved, return all cards to the Fate Deck and reshuffle it.
Example - The Leading Player draws the card : A Strong Gust

Card Text : Choose 1 straight line across the board(edge to edge). All fighters on that line MUST move by 1 square in a single direction of this card drawer’s choice. If that fighter is blocked by teammates, terrain or the battlefield’s edge, that fighter does NOT move.
All fighters on that line are moved 1 square. Proceed to Following Player’s card draw.
The Following Player draws the card : A Mild Drizzle
Card Text : A few raindrops fall, but nothing happens.)
No effect applied. Proceed to Combat Phase.
A straight line between starting and target squares (orthogonal or diagonal is allowed) with no High Terrain between attacker and target. Fighters do not block LoS.
Forced movement of exactly n squares in a direction (N, S, E, W). If the destination is off-board or occupied, do not move.
One direction(N, S, E, W) applied to all specified fighters.
Attacker’s total value for the attack is x, without modification.
